prompt: <description>**Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom edges are rounded, and the sides are straight. The model is centered and has a slight tilt to the left.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0659, 0.0]. **Creating the coordinate system for part 1:** 1. Define the Euler angles. 2. Define the translation vector. Now, create the 2D sketch for part 1 on the plane defined by the coordinate system. **Creating the 2D sketch for part 1:** 1. Create face 1 of the sketch. 1.1. Create loop 1 of face 1. 1.1.1. Draw line 1: (0.0, 0.1318) to (0.2283, 0.0). 1.1.2. Draw line 2: (0.2283, 0.0) to (0.6237, 0.0). 1.1.3. Draw line 3: (0.6237, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0). 1.1.4. Draw line 4: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.1582). 1.1.5. Draw line 5: (0.75, 0.1582) to (0.6237, 0.1582). 1.1.6. Draw line 6: (0.6237, 0.1582) to (0.6237, 0.1054). 1.1.7. Draw line 7: (0.6237, 0.1054) to (0.2565, 0.1054). 1.1.8. Draw line 8: (0.2565, 0.1054) to (0.1054, 0.1927). 1.1.9. Draw line 9: (0.1054, 0.1927) to (0.1054, 0.4761). 1.1.10. Draw line 10: (0.1054, 0.4761) to (0.0, 0.4761). 1.1.11. Draw line 11: (0.0, 0.4761) to (0.0, 0.1318). After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using the sketch scale parameter 0.75. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the defined euler angles and translation vector. **Transforming the 2D sketch to a 3D sketch:** 1. Apply the Euler angles and translation vector to the scaled 2D sketch. Now, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. **Extruding the 2D sketch:** 1. Extrude the sketch with an extrude depth towards the normal of 0.0659 and opposite normal depth of 0.0. Your final part 1 should have the following dimensions: - Height: 0.75 - Width: 0.0659 - Length: 0.75 The first part of the CAD model is now complete.</description>
